meanings.sent1: She decided to befringe the curtains with a colorful fringe.
meanings.sent2: The costume designer will befringe the dress with sparkly beads.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to befringe its tail with a piece of yarn, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun seemed to befringe the clouds with a golden glow.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes delicately befringe the canvas, adding depth to the painting.

meanings.definition: To form a fringe on or around.
meanings.sent1: The bushes befringe the garden path, creating a natural border.
meanings.sent2: The snow will befringe the rooftops with a layer of white.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully tried to befringe their sandcastle with seashells.
meanings.sent4: The stars befringe the night sky like tiny diamonds on black velvet.
meanings.sent5: The ivy vines befringe the old stone wall, adding a touch of nature to the structure.
